bibl.title: Aegyptiaca Romana: The Widening Debate.
bibl.note: Introduction to the conference. Gives an overview of the debate about the interactions between Egypt and Rome, explains the content of the proceedings and indicates some lines of inquiry.

bibl.title: Nile into Tiber. Egypt in the Roman World. Proceedings of the IIIrd International Conference of Isis Studies, Faculty of Archaeology, Leiden University, May 11-14 2005

bibl.seg: VERSLUYS Miguel John, Aegyptiaca Romana: The Widening Debate.

Laurent BRICAULT, Miguel John VERSLUYS and Paul G.P. MEYBOOM (Edd.), Nile into Tiber. Egypt in the Roman World. Proceedings of the IIIrd International Conference of Isis Studies, Faculty of Archaeology, Leiden University, May 11-14 2005 = Religions in the Graeco-Roman World. 159 (Leiden, 2007) pp. 1-14.
Introduction to the conference. Gives an overview of the debate about the interactions between Egypt and Rome, explains the content of the proceedings and indicates some lines of inquiry.
